intro: Havanella linearis, commonly known as the slender evergreen, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It produces small, fragrant blossoms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Havanella linearis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
